instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0A
threads.message:
Good evening, 

This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came ultrasoniced by another shop.
On ampmeter it showed 5v 0a.
Replaced ISL now it opens up the 20v but <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is stuck at 1v.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.41v

no shorts on any line.

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0A
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> power rail.
Any history about original symptom?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0A
threads.message:
Sorry for the long delay on replying.
Diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.45v.
Original Symptom was liquid dmg.
Nothing much tho.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0A
